revised_title: Symplectic Integration of Four-Vortex Motion: A Comparative Study
tldr: The article compares the performance of a symplectic integration method and a standard explicit Runge-Kutta scheme in simulating the motion of four identical point vortices. The symplectic method shows superior performance in preserving the Poincaré section and maintaining a smaller change in the Hamiltonian, indicating its effectiveness in long-time integration of Hamiltonian systems.
